BNC User Reference Guide

<corr>

corr (correction) contains the correct form of a passage apparently erroneous in the copy text.
Class att.rendered att.editLike model.pPart.edit
Declaration 
element corr
{
   attribute sic { text }?,
   att.rendered.attribute.rend,
   attribute resp { data.pointer }?,
   ( w | c | mw | gap )*
}
Attributes
(In addition to global attributes and those inherited from [att.rendered att.editLike ] )
sic contains verbatim text which has been corrected, or an empty string if the correction consists of an addition.
Status: Optional
Datatype (1–1) text
resp a code identifying the agency responsible for making the correction.
Status: Optional
Datatype (1–1) data.pointer
Values: A pointer to an element in the document header that is associated with a person asserted as responsible for some aspect of the text's creation, transcription, editing, or encoding.
Example
 <corr sic="existant"
xmlns:xaira="http://www.xaira.org/ns/1.0/spec"
xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
xmlns:rng="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0">
  <w c5="AJ0" hw="existent" pos="ADJ">existent </w>
 </corr>
